001package com.technototes.library.hardware.motor;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor;
004import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorSimple;
005import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range;
006import com.technototes.library.general.Invertable;
007import com.technototes.library.hardware.HardwareDevice;
008import java.util.function.Supplier;
009
010/**
011 * Class for motors
012 *
013 * @param <T> The qualcomm hardware device interface
014 * @author Alex Stedman
015 */
016@SuppressWarnings("unused")
017public class Motor<T extends DcMotorSimple>
018    extends HardwareDevice<T>
019    implements Invertable<Motor<T>>, Supplier<Double> {
020
021    private boolean invert = false;
022    private double min = -1, max = 1;
023
024    /**
025     * Create a motor
026     *
027     * @param device The hardware device
028     */
029    public Motor(T device) {
030        super(device);
031    }
032
033    /**
034     * Create a motor
035     *
036     * @param deviceName The device name
037     */
038    public Motor(String deviceName) {
039        super(deviceName);
040    }
041
042    /**
043     * Sets the min &amp; max values for the motor power (still clipped to -1/1)
044     *
045     * @param mi The minimum value
046     * @param ma The maximum value
047     * @return The Motor (for chaining)
048     */
049    public Motor<T> setLimits(double mi, double ma) {
050        min = Range.clip(mi, -1, 1);
051        max = Range.clip(ma, -1, 1);
052        return this;
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Returns whether the motor is inverted. WARNING: THIS RETURNS TRUE FOR A "FORWARD" SETTING!
057     *
058     * @return True for inverted (forward) false for not inverted (reverse)
059     */
060    @Override
061    public boolean getInverted() {
062        return invert;
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * Set the Inverted state for the motor. WARNING: THIS IS BACKWARD TO WHAT YOU MIGHT THINK!
067     * True - Motor goes *forward*. False - motor goes *reverse*.
068     *
069     * @param inv true for forward, false for reverse (probably not what you were expecting)
070     * @return The motor (for chaining)
071     */
072    @Override
073    public Motor<T> setInverted(boolean inv) {
074        getDevice()
075            .setDirection(inv ? DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD : DcMotorSimple.Direction.REVERSE);
076        invert = inv;
077        return this;
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Invert the motor (toggle inversion)
082     *
083     * @return The motor (for chaining)
084     */
085    @Override
086    public Motor<T> invert() {
087        return setInverted(!getInverted());
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Gets the power value for the motor
092     *
093     * @return the power value (as a double)
094     */
095    public double getSpeed() {
096        return device.getPower();
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Set speed of motor
101     *
102     * @param speed The speed of the motor
103     */
104    public void setSpeed(double speed) {
105        device.setPower(Range.clip(speed, min, max));
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Configure the motor to *brake* when the power is set to zero.
110     *
111     * @return The Motor device (for chaining)
112     */
113    public Motor<T> brake() {
114        if (getDevice() instanceof DcMotor) ((DcMotor) getDevice()).setZeroPowerBehavior(
115                DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior.BRAKE
116            );
117        return this;
118    }
119
120    /**
121     * Configure the motor to *float* when the power is set to zero.
122     *
123     * @return The Motor device (for chaining)
124     */
125    public Motor<T> coast() {
126        if (getDevice() instanceof DcMotor) ((DcMotor) getDevice()).setZeroPowerBehavior(
127                DcMotor.ZeroPowerBehavior.FLOAT
128            );
129        return this;
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Gets the *speed* of the motor when it's used as a DoubleSupplier
134     *
135     * @return The speed of the motor
136     */
137    @Override
138    public Double get() {
139        return getSpeed();
140    }
141}
